unit_learning_outcomes.description: Select and apply practical and/or theoretical techniques or tools from your discipline to conduct an investigation.
Explain the role and relevance of science in society, using examples from your and other scientific disciplines.
Work effectively, responsibly and safely, as an individual and as part of a team, applying knowledge of ethical principles and professional conduct.
Design and plan a professional cross-disciplinary investigation, using scientific thinking and creative strategies to devise and promote innovation.
Plan your next steps after graduation, through an appraisal of personal achievements and the current and projected work environment.
Explain, with an employment and interview focus, how your study and achievements transfer to other contexts, orally and in writing.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Modules to cover required skills and knowledge for workshop activities
Putting unit materials into personal context

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to (BSc or BAdvSc) and 80cp at 2000 level or above

assessments.description: Plan for a cross-disciplinary project. Components of peer and self-assessment.
Present and pitch a team project via video. Includes formative exercise and peer assessment.
Generate a project idea and pitch it as a team via video to a non-expert audience.

assessments.assessment_title: Reflection on your skills, knowledge and capabilities
assessments.description: Reflective writing relating studies and experiences to future plans (may include CV/cover letter; application for research degree etc.)

relationships.academic_item_name: Making Science Work for You and Society: Capstone

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: FOSE3000 - Making Science Work for You and Society: Capstone
data.description: How do the skills and knowledge you have acquired fit you for the next step beyond your degree? What is the role of scientific thinking in the workplace and in solving society’s problems? A major component of this unit is a cross-disciplinary project, in which you will collaborate with students from other majors in the Bachelor of Science. You will identify and practice employability and workplace skills, connecting your university experiences to career aspirations. By actively reflecting on prior learning and experiences, you will build and articulate a positive self-understanding, exploring opportunities and clarifying goals for the next stage of your career.
data.search_title: FOSE3000 - Making Science Work for You and Society: Capstone
